scenario_text.value: You’re looking kind of grim, Saki.
Takuma... I’m scared.

Things are only going to get more dangerous,
aren’t they? I could get hurt, or even die.
Don’t worry! We’ll protect everyone!

I know things are dangerous here, but don’t
forget about us!
Agumon, Floramon...
Thank you. I believe in you both.
But I still can’t get over my own weakness.

(Saki seems to be considering her next course
of action way more seriously than usual.)

(That’s why she’s overthinking, and getting
herself all worked up.)

(Still, I wanna support what she’s trying to
do—encourage the way she’s thinking now.)
(How can I encourage Saki?)
We can trust them.
Don’t worry!
Okay to be weak.

Don’t worry, Agumon and the others will
protect us for sure. Let’s trust them.
Yeah... Yeah, you’re right.

Hey, Floramon. You’ll still protect me, even
if I’m not as brave as before?

Do you think that makes me a coward? Do you
hate me for it?

It doesn’t bother me. I think it’s normal to
be scared.

And you shouldn’t hate yourself just because
you’re not as strong as you want to be.
I don’t think any less of you for it.
You’re my friend, Saki!
Oh, Floramon...

Don’t worry, Saki! I know it’s dangerous, but
things will all work out.
How do you know that?

I don’t know any proof or anything... Just,
we have to think that way to make it happen.
But that’s hardly...
Ahhh, no, this is all wrong!

Spouting all these negative things isn’t my
style at all!

It doesn’t bother me. I think it’s normal to
feel negative sometimes.

When you acknowledge your own weakness,
that’s when you can really move forward.
Huh... So that’s how it works?

It’s not something to put yourself down over.
Weakness isn’t a bad thing.

Yeah, that just means you see things more
realistically than before.
Huh, you think so?

Yeah. I feel like you tried to avoid seeing
the tough stuff before.

But now you’re taking in everything—that’s
what makes you anxious and worried.

Next, take a good, hard look at how you’re
scared of being able to see your weakness.
Yeah, Floramon’s right.

If you accept your own weakness, I’m sure
you’ll know how to handle it next time.

Yeah... Yeah, you’re right. I feel better
now, somehow.
There’s nothing wrong with being me.
Yep, not a thing.

I wonder what’s coming our way? It’s gonna
get even dicier from here on out, I bet.
